sections.name: Tolokand
Walkers and Horsemen
sections.text: Though tolokands slowly push the world toward destruction, they don't follow deities of destruction, such as Rovagug or the Four Horsemen. Priests of Rovagug tend to see tolokands as kindred spirits, but opinion differs among the Horsemen's followers. Some approve of any force accelerating destruction, but others believe the apocalypse must come at the Horsemen's direction.

Streams run dry. The earth cracks. Green leaves brown and shatter. And the creature walks on.  
  
 The faceless, unknowable tolokands wander the land, bringing desolation with every footfall—belching poisonous smoke, blighting plant life, cracking the earth asunder, and even staining the ground with their foul blood. They turn habitable places into wastelands, which has earned tolokands the name “waste walkers.” These walking forces of destruction don't make their motives known. They remain unmoved by any pleas or threats levied at them, and they fight off attacks only so that they can return to their grim business. However, they have one consistent tendency: they travel to environments on the brink. A tolokand appears in a land wracked by famine or a natural disaster to give it the last push into oblivion.  
  
 Tolokands are mercifully few in number. Since they appear so rarely, it's unclear whether there are just a few individuals or several dozen. Clearly, more than one exists, though, because their patterned soles are as distinctive as fingerprints. Often, these smoking footprints are all that remain in a blighted land.

traits.name: Rare
traits.text: This rarity indicates that a rules element is very difficult to find in the game world. A rare feat, spell, item or the like is available to players only if the GM decides to include it in the game, typically through discovery during play. Creatures with this trait are rare. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creatures is increased by 5.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Aberration
traits.text: Aberrations are creatures from beyond the planes or corruptions of the natural order.

interaction_abilities.name: Smoke Vision
interaction_abilities.text: Smoke doesn't impair a tolokand's vision; it ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

modifiers.name: +2 status to all saves vs. primal magic

automatic_abilities.name: Heartless Furnace

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item or a creature with a strong alignment.

traits.name: Conjuration
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the conjuration school of magic, typically involving summoning, creation, teleportation, or moving things from place to place.

traits.name: Occult
traits.text: This magic comes from the occult tradition, calling upon bizarre and ephemeral mysteries. Anything with this trait is magical.

automatic_abilities.text: The poisonous smoke that bellows from a tolokand makes all creatures inside it concealed, and all creatures outside the smoke are concealed to creatures within it.

automatic_abilities.name: Inexorable
automatic_abilities.text: The tolokand recovers from the paralyzed, slowed, and stunned conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

automatic_abilities.name: Toxic Blood
automatic_abilities.text: When a creature scores a critical hit against the tolokand with a piercing or slashing Strike, the tolokand's poisonous, oily blood sprays forth. Any creature within 5 feet of the tolokand takes 3d6 poison damage (DC 34 basic Reflex save). Any non-creature plants the blood spills on die.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

ability.name: Blighted Footfalls
ability.text: Whenever the tolokand ends a move action during which it moved 30 feet or farther, it automatically casts one of its innate spells as a free action.

ability.name: Sudden Destruction
ability.requirement: The tolokand hasn't cast any of its spontaneous spells this turn
ability.effect: The tolokand casts one of its spontaneous spells, using up the spell slot normally. The tolokand can't cast any further spontaneous spells this turn and can't use this ability again for 1d4 rounds
